did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Parapsychology researcher and author who worked with J.B. Rhine at Duke University from 1951 to 1957.

Collection comprises correspondence with professional colleagues and others; case files concerning Osis's investigations of poltergeists, spontaneous apparitions, ESP, out-of-body and near-death experiences, and other parapsychological events; research proposals, speeches, reviews, and other writings by Osis; administrative materials for the American Society for Psychical Research; and miscellaneous materials concerning Osis's research.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is restricted. Patrons must sign research agreement prior to working with materials.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Kārlis Osis Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Kārlis Osis Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1998.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession(s) described in this finding aid: 1998-0390
The collection has been given basic processing: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition. Staff may need to process further before materials can be accessed.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises correspondence with professional colleagues and others; case files concerning Osis's investigations of poltergeists, spontaneous apparitions, ESP, out-of-body and near-death experiences, and other parapsychological events; research proposals, speeches, reviews, and other writings by Osis; administrative materials for the American Society for Psychical Research; and miscellaneous materials concerning Osis's research.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.
